dmca.title: [ThePlanetAbuse-C2743820H] VIOLATION of Freedom of Information and Privacy Act
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the
Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your
claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
-----Original Message-----
From: Ramkrishna Swamy [mailto:rswamy@ualberta.ca] 
Sent: Monday, January 29, 2007 12:58 PM
To: Copyright; EV1 Abuse; HOU- NOC; HOU- NOC; EV1 Abuse; EV1 Abuse
Subject: Re: FW: [ThePlanetAbuse-C2743820H] VIOLATION of Freedom of
Information and Privacy Act

Hello,
I believe I'm getting an automated response from the Legal Response
team. 
I'm basically for someone who can remove ALL PAGES PERTAINING TO ME ON
www.engineers-international.com:
http://www.engineers-international.com/Candidates/RAMKRISHNA_SWAMY.html

I received the email addresses from the following page:
http://whois.domaintools.com/engineers-international.com

Thank you,
Ram



On Mon, 29 Jan 2007, Copyright wrote:

> To Whom It May Concern:
>
> Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does 
> not substantially comply with the required notification elements of 
> the Digital Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").
>
> Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your 
> claim.
>
> Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/index.html?p=copyright.
>
> Legal Response Team
> THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Ramkrishna Swamy [mailto:rswamy@ualberta.ca]
> Sent: Sunday, January 28, 2007 11:55 PM
> To: Copyright
> Cc: Theplanet@chillingeffects.org
> Subject: RE: [ThePlanetAbuse-C2743820H] VIOLATION of Freedom of 
> Information and Privacy Act
>
> Hi,
> I'm not sure what the result of this will be.
> I'm not trying to attempting to sue or anything.  I would simply like 
> the material pertaining to me REMOVED from Engineers-International.com
>
> Please let me know the status of this ASAP.
>
> Thanks,
> Ram
>
> --------------------------------------------------
> Ramkrishna Swamy
> MSc. Student
> Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering University of 
> Alberta
> Email: rswamy@ualberta.ca
> --------------------------------------------------
>

> Thread-Index: AcdCa3Ff1sV3uuKORmmDBgPOr1UvKA==
> X-Virus-Scanned: by Barracuda Spam Firewall at ev1servers.net
> X-Barracuda-Spam-Score: 0.00
> X-Barracuda-Spam-Status: No, SCORE=0.00 using global scores of 
> TAG_LEVEL=4.0 QUARANTINE_LEVEL=1000.0 KILL_LEVEL=8.0 tests=
> X-Barracuda-Spam-Report: Code version 3.02, rules version 3.0.32512
>         Rule breakdown below  pts rule name              description
>         ---- ----------------------
> --------------------------------------------------
> Return-Path: rswamy@ualberta.ca
> X-OriginalArrivalTime: 27 Jan 2007 23:32:53.0368 (UTC) 
> FILETIME=[774AE780:01C7426B]
>
> MIME element (text/plain)
> Hello Valarie Stinson and Chris Newcomb, I have tried to reach someone

> regarding the issue I'm having with Engineers-International.com.  As a

> last resort, I'm sending you the email with my problem.
>
> As long as I can remember, I do not remember posting my CV on the 
> website of Engineers-International.  However, they somehow received my

> CV (hopefully not through spiders or spyware) and they have posted all

> of the information making it viewable by everyone on the internet.
>
> This clearly VIOLATES Canada's Freedom of Information and Privacy Act,

> as they publish my email address, home phone number, home address,
etc.
> - everything on my Resume.
>
> Ever since I came to know about this issue, I have tried long and hard

> to get this off of the internet ASAP. I have tried contact the 
> webmaster and the website's designer and have received no response 
> from them.  I cannot login nor can I remove this off their site
permanently.
>
> Here is the link to the page that comes up when Google'ed:
> http://www.engineers-international.com/Candidates/RAMKRISHNA_SWAMY.htm
> l
>
> I would appreciate if MY ENTIRE ACCOUNT IS DELETED AND I DON'T WANT 
> ANY AFFLIATION WITH ENGINEERS-INTERNATIONAL WHATSOEVER.  PLEASE MAKE 
> SURE THIS IS CORRECTED ASAP.
>
> Thank you very much,
> Ram Swamy
>
> --------------------------------------------------
> Ramkrishna Swamy
> MSc. Student
> Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering University of 
> Alberta
> Email: rswamy@ualberta.ca
> --------------------------------------------------
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
